column4: Hello Can anyone please help me, I am trying to install 7.10 on my dual g4 PPC and when it oots of the cd i just get a grey video screen, i do not even get to anykind of menu
I have tried the stable release and the alternitive cd
nithier work
i think the last ppc version is 6.10 but i aint sure
as i said, ppc isnt tsupported in latest. Try to install 6.10 and then try to uptade you way up to lateast supported version
ubuntu's website has released the lattest version of 7.10 for ubuntu, was this just the latest packes non tested? last stable tested version is 6.10?
gimme a few sec, i have to check
http://cdimage.ubuntu.com/ports/releases/7.10/release/ubuntu-7.10-desktop-powerpc.iso did you use that one?
yes i did
should work.. have you got any odd cards or upgrades in your machine'?
no it is all stock. it seems like for some reason it can not decide what video driver to use hence the screen being grey
what gfx card are you using?
have you tried installing in VESA mode?
are you holding C while booting up?
have you tried installing in terminal?
if you use "live-nosplash-powerpc video=ofonly" at boot when using the minimal install cd you should be able to install. the problems seems to be with usplash
gimme a little while and ill hunt it for you
btw had you tried that options with the alternative cd?
http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/dists/gutsy/main/installer-powerpc/current/images/powerpc/netboot/mini.iso
try booting from that one
then you can install ubuntu-desktop manually. thus skip that problem
its an massive 8mb download =P
darn.
as mini does not include any display drivers or usplash, im very preplexed about the outcome
